poem:
**Whispers of a Translucent Age**

The years pass, ripples  
on the lake of time, shifting  
what we thought was solid.  
Songs weave through air,  
once a single path, now a forest,  
each note a leaf, fragile in its freedom.  
Memory clings to the tangible,  
the orange glow of youth,  
a whisper beneath baggy jeans.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guide #188: How 25 years of music has shaped the charts from monoculture to mass playlists Somehow we’re a quarter of the way through the 21st century (or 1/40th through the new millennia, for those taking a really long view of things). How did that happen? It doesn’t seem long ago that I was sitting on a translucent orange inflatable sofa, clad in jeans so baggy that you could fit your entire face in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
